intro_text: r_c spots a swift fox in the distance, behaving weirdly. It's the biggest of the foxes in c_n's territory, the size of a cat, and r_c is alone. Should they try and take it on?
decline_text: Best not to risk a fight. r_c watches it go.

success_outcomes.text: Sneaking closer, r_c realizes that the wind carries the scent of milk from the vixen. She has cubs. Eventually she leaves the area, and r_c begins the hunt, checking every burrow, every crevice, every hole until {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/stumble/stumbles} over the den. Two of the cubs flee into the desert, while the third falls to r_c's claws.

She has a den, r_c realizes, one perched just under a rocky slope. Once the vixen leaves, r_c uses the rubble around it to bury the den and its contents. No swift cubs will be raised within c_n's borders.

s_c scents the air, following the milk scent of the mother fox from afar. It means they can position themselves for the perfect ambush, leaping from cover to fasten their teeth in her throat. Her cubs will be old enough to survive without her, but this vixen will never raise kitten killers again.

fail_outcomes.text: The swift fox spots r_c coming and scarpers, tucking tail and fleeing across the horizon in an example of where the small carnivore gets its name.
As r_c descends on the vixen, her scream of surprise brings in her mate, changing the odds. The male bursts out from cover and sinks his teeth into r_c, then both foxes take the chance to flee.

history_text.scar: m_c was marked by a fight with a swift fox vixen.

intro_text: The sun beats down on the desert, driving every creature away from its gaze with blinding heat.
decline_text: Giving up on the hunt, r_c finds a burrow to wait out the heat of the day until they can return back to camp.

success_outcomes.text: r_c watches from the shade of a large rock formation. Eventually their wait pays off, and they spot a lizard searching for shelter from the sun, but their pounce is too soon, and their prey lives to see another day.

r_c considers pushing through to try to find a catch, but it's not worth it. They find a burrow to wait out the heat of the day - except this burrow seems occupied. The tortoise inside puts up a fight, but r_c manages to flip their positions and drive it out into the heat, which slowly kills it.

Anticipating the heat of the sun, s_c has positioned themselves in the shadowed depths around a shaded tiny pool in the rocks. As predicted, it's not long until the water draws in a Thunderpath-runner, and the bird is dispatched neatly and quietly.

s_c watches from the shade of a large rock formation. Eventually their wait pays off, and they spot a lizard searching for shelter from the sun. It finds shelter, but also s_c, and they settle back down to wait until it's cooler to try and bring their catch back to c_n.

fail_outcomes.text: Making the smart choice, r_c doesn't move from the shade, taking a good long nap in the heat.

intro_text: The sun beats down on the desert, driving every creature away from its gaze with blinding heat.
decline_text: Giving up on the hunt, r_c finds a burrow to wait out the heat of the day until they can return back to camp.

success_outcomes.text: app1 considers pushing through to try to find a catch, but it's not worth it. They find a burrow to wait out the heat of the day - except their burrow is occupied, and app1 instead has to wait out the heat in the uncomfortable shade of a cactus.

s_c watches from the shade of a large rock formation. Eventually their wait pays off, and they spot a lizard searching for shelter from the sun. It finds shelter, but sadly not in the place s_c waits.

fail_outcomes.text: Making the smart choice, app1 doesn't move from the shade, taking a good long nap in the heat.
app1 doesn't make it back to camp. A patrol sent out for them find their body, collapsed in a shadeless part of the territory and already starting to dry out and mummify.

history_text.scar: This cat got heatstroke while on a patrol.
history_text.reg_death: This cat died from heat stroke.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 collapses from heat exhaustion while trying to position themselves for a hunt. They're able to move to the shade, but the hunt is over, and it's only when a Clanmate finds them that they're able to totter home shakily.

history_text.scar: This cat got heatstroke while on a patrol.
history_text.reg_death: This cat died from heat stroke.

intro_text: The patrol spots a swift fox in the distance, behaving weirdly.
decline_text: Best not to risk a fight. The patrol watches it go.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol charges the vixen, and she runs, leaving the scent of milk in the air behind her. But they don't know where her cubs might've been hidden, and they'll be old enough to survive without her - this bodes ill for greenleaf.

The patrol sneaks closer, until p_l realizes that the vixen is approaching her den. Her cubs, nearly full grown on prey stolen from c_n's territory, poke their heads out, and the cats yowl in outrage. They charge the den, killing two of the cubs before the vixen runs with her third.

s_c holds the patrol back until they spot the vixen's mate, approaching with poached prey in his jaws. Together, the cats ambush the foxes, bursting from cover with claws unsheathed as a vicious fight starts. But warriors fight as a team, and the foxes do not, and one flees, abandoning its mate and cubs to the fury of c_n.

fail_outcomes.text: The swift fox spots the patrol coming and scarpers, tucking tail and fleeing across the horizon in an example of where the small carnivore gets its name.

As the patrol descends on the vixen, her scream of surprise brings in her mate, changing the odds. The male bursts out from cover and sinks his teeth into r_c, both foxes using the patrol switching to r_c's defense as their signal to flee.

history_text.scar: m_c was marked by a fight with a swift fox vixen.
